column1: Jalesar is a town and a Nagar Palika Parishad in Etah district in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. It is connected by road to other towns such as Hathras
On 10 December 2016 Union Minister Mr. Nitin Gadkari has extended Jaipur Bareilly 4 lane NH 21 via Agra

column1: Jalesar is a Nagar Palika Parishad in district of Etah
column2: Uttar Pradesh. The Jalesar is divided into 25 wards for which elections are held every 5 years. The Jalesar has population of 58
column5: 957 are females as per report released by Census India 2011. Jalesar has total administration over 13980 houses to which it supplies basic amenities like water and sewerage.

column1: Jalesar town has been built around market which is spread roughly 2.5 km in length. Main market.

Patna Bird Sanctuary is a lovely place to visit which is situated approximately 5.5 km away on Sikandra Rao Road.  Best time to visit this place is September to February however in December and January
column2: it becomes residence of migrated birds from European and American zones. Jalesar is a town of brass and famous for its 'Pital Udhyog' which has never faded its shine. Jalesar is known for its cast Temple bells

column1: Famous Temples are Ram Mandir in Gali Boharan
column2: Chintaharan Mandir & Laxmi Narayan Mandir near Govt. Hospital
column3: Pathwari Mandir situated on road to Hathras Junction and Hanuman Mandir in Mahavir Ganj Other temples in the area are Bhairo Bagichi

column1: Famous Mosque Sunheri Masjid in Kila Road
column3: Ek Minar Masjid in Bazar bisat Khana & Masjid Markaz in Memran.

column1: Jalesar is famous for Saturday Jaat for which people from farther towns and villages visit to devote their respect. This has been custom for many years and being continued. Another attraction is Dargah Place which is located near old Basant Vatika and has been a place to Organize Urs Mela which is enjoyed by residents. Dargah place has holistic importance for its residents. Nearby Dargah place a Famous Shani Mandir is also situated well known for Saturday Aarti.
